problem:
r1=random.randrange(1,10,1) r2=random.randrange(1,10,1) r3=random.randrange(1,10,1) i=random.randrange(1,10,1) rthev=1/(1/float(r3)+1/float(r1+r2)) vthev=i*(1/float(r2)+1/float(r1+r3)) power=i*i/(1/float(r2)+1/float(r1+r3))
Take a resistor network with R1=$r1 ohms, R2=$r2 ohms, R3=$r3 ohms, and I=$i amps:
Assuming the output is disconnected, what is the resistance seen at the output?
Feynmann criticised instructors who, either out of ignorance or out of carelessness, gave unrealistic problems or examples. Try to figure out if we're guilty of this. How much power is dissipated in this network?
